result.execSummary:
The defendant VIRGIL BRANDON KNIGHT was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
IMPOSED AND STAYED
concurrent with ct 2, consecutive to any other sentence. Good time granted. Credit for 3 days. Huber granted, if in compliance with jail facility regulations.

miscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are to be paid directly to the Winnebago County Clerk of Courts within 60 days. Payment plans are available in the Clerk of Courts office. Do NOT pay Probation Agent. Debts older than 90 days will be processed for civil judgment and sent to the Department of Revenue for collection including tax intercept. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Complete compas assessment,  counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup.

Pay supervisory fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.  Immediately following court, contact Court Security at 920-236-4906 to schedule an appointment.  The appointment location is:  Room 15 on the lower level of the Courthouse, 415 Jackson Street Oshkosh WI.  Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes stating a DNA sample is required.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats., 946.52.
No use or possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician.   No possession of drug paraphernalia.

records.addlTxt: Defendant VIRGIL BRANDON KNIGHT in court.  Amanda Nash appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant VIRGIL BRANDON KNIGHT in court.  Nerrissa L Dyett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law. Defendant to contact public defender's office.  Bond continues.  Further proceedings scheduled for February 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.

DC(DV), POSS OF THC, POSS DRUG PARA
CONDITIONS:   No violent contact with V1 in Fox Crossing report #22-42.  No possession or consumption of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.  Defendant does acknowledge they've been advised who the victim(s) is/are.

03:09 PM Defendant VIRGIL BRANDON KNIGHT in court with attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer.  Defendant VIRGIL BRANDON KNIGHT in custody.  Christian A. Gossett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  VIRGIL BRANDON KNIGHT appeared by video means with Attorney.  Given/has complaint. Advised of charges & potential penalties.  The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  Defendant doesn't qualify for the Public Defender.  Record closed @ 3:13.
